channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: There is a cracked and broken manhole cover by the corner of Perry St & Iron Mill Lane by 2 Iron Mill Lane which requires repairing, 1st August
item.description:
There is a cracked and broken manhole cover by the corner of Perry St & Iron Mill Lane by number 2 Iron Mill Lane which requires repairing- resident is going to send in photos of this to footscraydirect@bexley.gov.uk
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Iron Mill Lane, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potential Flytipping, 1st August
item.description:
There is already a pile of rubble from the recent road fix on Ravensbourne Avenue, crossing with Farnaby. Today, there was a commercial vehicle from an organisation called Academy contractors tipping more into that pile. It may be another council-approved contractor. You will be able to tell.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More Flytipping, 1st August
item.description:
This is a constant issue and weekly. Rubbish and other things being left from the businesses opposite. Bags are being ripped open by foxes and flys are everywhere. Some sort of enforcements needs to be implemented because this is an ongoing issue

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manor Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Truck hit signpost, 1st August
item.description:
Our driver was turning right and the rear of the trailer has caught the signpost and caused it to lean and lift some of the paving stones surrounding the base of the post. From, David Watson Transport Ltd

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 178, Wardour Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking, 1st August
item.description:
Cars parked dangerously both sides of road in Lensbury way se2 9sy people using it as a car park for Abbey Wood station and Elizabeth line basically turning it into one way street with a school and nursery its only matter of time before a child is going to get hurt, this has been going on for months now, plus cars are being parked outside residents garages leaving they cars there all day while they’ve gone to work leaving residents without access to there own property, could this be addressed as a matter of urgency please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lensbury Way, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
